news.title: Google Extends Free Access to Advanced Teleconferencing Features to September 30th
news.description: Google is making certain Google Meet features free until the end of September, allowing all G Suite users to host meetings for up to 250 and save recorded meetings to Google Drive.

news.title: Apple and Google Team Up to ‘Contact Trace’ the Coronavirus
news.description: Tech rivals Apple and Google are collaborating to build software into smartphones that will allow users to determine if they have been in close proximity to someone with COVID-19.

news.title: SCOTUS Will Hear Arguments by Telephone Conference in Several Cases Because of COVID-19
news.description: Due to the coronavirus pandemic, the nation’s top court has announced that it will conduct oral arguments via telephone conference for several cases during the month of May.

news.title: French Regulator Says Google Must Pay News Sites to Send Them Traffic
news.description: Pursuant to recent EU copyright legislation, French authorities have determined that Google must pay to link articles on the country’s news sites, which Google has thus far refused to do.

news.title: Google Uses Location Data to Show Which Places Are Complying With Stay-At-Home Orders -- and Which Aren’t
news.description: Data from users who have opted in to sharing their location history with Google are helping government officials assess which communities are heeding instructions to shelter in place.

news.title: ‘Zoombombing’ Is a Federal Offense that Could Result in Imprisonment, Prosecutors Warn
news.description: Government officials have issued a warning that the increasingly popular trend of hacking into video conference calls can lead to arrest and criminal charges resulting in fines and jail time.
